TestCase.TestCaseTitle: Handling of RequestID: ensure it is return in the response
TestCase.TestCaseObjective: Ensure that the RequestID provided on a ReadRequest is returned on the corresponding ReadResponse
TestCase.TestCaseScenario: Test of handling of the RequestID over the Request/Response exchange pattern
TestCase.TestCasePreCondition:
MIP4SLT1_1211, MIP4SLT1_1213, MIP4SLT1_1214
Prior to initiating exchange of MIP4.0 messages, each participant in the exchange will complete the MIP4.0 Joining Questionnaire [REF-MIP-5] and share this questionnaire with their exchange partners. The exchange of completed questionnaires will: * Inform exchange partners of the capabilities of a partner system * Allow partners to exchange source identifiers * Aid in the early identification of potential issues
The exchange partners are expected to resolve any identified issues prior to the actual exchange of MIP4.0 messages.
Exigence-1: Prior to initiating MIP4.0 Information Exchange, the exchange partners shall complete and share the MIP4.0 Joining Questionnaire.[REF-MIP-5]
TestCase.TestCaseInput: ReadRequest on a topic, Including a RequestID
TestCase.TestCaseConclusion: The test is completed when the consumer receives in the RequestResponse the same RequestID that has been sent from the corresponding ReadRequest.
TestCase.TestCaseOutput: Verification that the RequestID contained in the WSMPMsg received in the response is the same as the corresponding request.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Consumer (1) requests information about items from the provider (2) using a TopicExpression. An identifier is provided by the Consumer on the request via the attribute RequestID.
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Provider receives and interprets the request correctly.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Provider respond to the request made by the consumer and includes the identifier from the Consumer request, RequestID.
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Consumer received the response from the Provider. Consumer confirms the identifier sent on the request is the same identifier on the response received from the Provider.
